name: Ref docs - Issued drawings / Site copy drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Check that you have the latest site and engineering drawings BEFORE starting each task/set of tasks.
Acceptance Criteria - Prepare a lot map for traceability of the work area
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Acceptance Criteria - Underlying services and/or assets have been installed prior to commencing works over and/or above. Refer underlying lot ITP(s)
Acceptance Criteria - Setout pits to the location and levels on the drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Excavate to the depths and widths of the design drawings
Ref docs - Spec. 0002 General Electrical [Cl 6.11] Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Pits to be installed on a 100mm thick compacted sand base.
○ Alternatively, a 150mm thick 20mm crushed rock layer can be used if the pit floor is below the water table.'
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Acceptance Criteria - Blinding (15MPa) for Pit Bases to be a 50mm thick mass concrete layer.
Ref docs - Spec. 0319 Minor Concrete Works [Cl 4.3] Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Formwork installed as per drawings and adequately supported.
○ Completed formwork to be inspected by the Superintendent prior to concrete placement
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Ref docs - Spec. 0319 Minor Concrete Works [Cl 4.5], Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Reinforcement installed as per drawings, ensuring sufficient lap length and cover is achieved on all bars.
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Ref docs - Spec. 0319 Minor Concrete Works [Cl 4.3], Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Formwork installed as per drawings and adequately supported.
○ Completed formwork to be inspected by the Superintendent prior to concrete placement
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Ref docs - Spec. 0319 Minor Concrete Works [Cl 4.5], Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Reinforcement installed as per drawings, ensuring sufficient lap length and cover is achieved on all bars.
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Acceptance Criteria - All conduit entries are to be fitted with proprietary bell-mouths installed flush with the pit wall as per manufacturer specifications
Ref docs - Spec. 0319 Minor Concrete Works [Cl 4.8, 4.9, 4.10, 4.11], Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Concrete strength of cast in-situ units shall be min. Grade N32 or as otherwise stated on drawings.
○ Ensure the temperature of freshly mixed concrete is maintained in between 5°C and 35°C. Ensure elapsed time between batching and discharge of the mix complies with the below table.
Concrete temp at discharge (°C) || Max elapsed time (hours)
○ Concrete placed in layers ≤ 300mm thick and adequately vibrated avoiding over-vibration.
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Ref docs - Spec. 0319 Minor Concrete Works [Cl 4.2]
Acceptance Criteria - The nominal rate of sampling shall be taken:
(a) Compressive strength: One set per pour or as otherwise directed by the Superintendent;
(b) Slump: One per batch of concrete
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Acceptance Criteria - Average compressive strength at 28 days meets minimum design requirements. Slump within tolerances specified in AS 1379
Testing to be in a NATA accredited test facility
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Ref docs - Spec. 0319 Minor Concrete Works [Cl 4.13]
Acceptance Criteria - From completion of finishing; cure continuously with either curing compound, wet curing or form retention for a min period of 7 days or as directed by the Superintendent.
Acceptance Criteria - Pits to be backfilled in 150mm thick layers for a horizontal distance of 300mm as per RFI-069

○ Backfill to be with a thermally rated compacted sand as per the design drawings up until the top of the conduit bank. The remaining backfill above the conduits to be Select fill for material within 1.5m of pavement and General Fill below 1.5m deep.
○ Select backfill material to be a granular material with a maximum particle size of 50mm and a PI between 2 & 12
○ Backfill shall not commence until concrete compressive strength reaches 15MPa unless approved otherwise by superintendent
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Ref docs - Spec. 0002 General Electrical Installation [Cl 6.6], Spec. 1112 Earthworks [Cl 4.13]

Acceptance Criteria - Each layer to be compacted to a density that is no less than the density of the existing adjacent material. If the existing material density is unknown, minimum relative compaction to be:
95% for pit bedding and conduit embedment
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Ref docs - Spec. 1354 Stormwater Drainage Structures [Cl 3.3]
Acceptance Criteria - Access covers, grates and frames to be installed as per AS 3996
Ref docs - Spec. 1354 Stormwater Drainage Structures [Cl 3.3]
Acceptance Criteria - Pits deeper than 600 to be fitted with galvanised plastic-coated step irons as per AS1657
Ref docs - Spec. 0002 General Electrical Installation [Cl 6.11], Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Brass marker plates to be installed at each pit showing cable/conduit routes, contact phone number, organisation & drawing number.
Acceptance Criteria - An as-built survey of the drainage system been completed to ensure all structures are within construction tolerances.
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
5.2 - Acceptance and closure of non-conforming items
Acceptance Criteria - NCRs to be opened for non-conforming items and closed prior to closing construction lot.
